sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"人造的，非自然的"之意。
means: artificial ：指模仿天然材料由人工制造的东西，侧重真伪对比。
false ：指因缺失而补上的替代物，有时也指伪装的。
synthetic与artificial近义，但前者强调通过化学作用或化学处理把几种物质复制成与原材料截然不同的新产品。
man-made ：指完全用人工制造，不含仿造和真伪对比的意味。

sentence.Network_en: He decided to do something about reforesting man-made wastes of western Australia.
sentence.Network_cn: 他决定为在澳大利亚西部人为导致荒芜的土地上重新造林做点事情。

sentence.Network_en: Man-made and natural disasters have disrupted the Government's economic plans.
sentence.Network_cn: 天灾人祸打乱了政府的经济计划。

sentence.Network_en: Gately, a quiet and very polite young man, made a favourable impression.
sentence.Network_cn: 盖特利是一个言语不多、执礼甚恭的年轻人，他给人留下了很好的印象。

entry.def: Man-made things are created or caused by people, rather than occurring naturally.

example.ex: Man-made and natural disasters have disrupted the Government's economic plans.
example.tran: 天灾人祸打乱了政府的经济计划。

means.word_mean: 1. not of natural origin; prepared or made artificially;

auth_sentence.content: It has nothing to do with man-made global warming.
auth_sentence.res_content: It has nothing to do with man-made global warming.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It has nothing to do with man-made global warming.

auth_sentence.content: This is a man-made crisis, a policy crisis.

auth_sentence.content: They are all harmful man-made radiations according to you.

sentences.en: man-made substances not found in nature
sentences.cn: 自然界找不到的人造材料
